children.name: Economic Development
Reduce peak period travel times
Average travel time during AM and PM peak periods on major corridors
Increase transportation investment which focuses on economic vitality
Change in employment or economic output in areas with new or improved transportation facilities
Improve reliability of travel to regional activity centers
Planning Time Index (95th percentile travel time / free flow travel time) to/from activity centers
Increase multimodal access to regional activity centers
Percentage of population within ½ mile of transit routes serving activity centers
Reduce freight bottlenecks
Average truck travel time index (TTTI) on freight-priority corridors
Expand and maintain a regional network of sidewalks, bike lanes, and multi-use trails
Total miles of sidewalks, bike lanes, and multi-use trails regionwide
Equity/Accessibility
Reduce trip length for all people with a focus on Environmental Justice populations
Average trip length (in miles) by mode and population type (e.g., EJ vs. non-EJ)
Increase access to jobs and community services via transit, walking, and biking
Percentage of EJ population within a ½-mile walk of frequent transit service
Number of jobs accessible within 30 minutes by transit, walking, or biking, disaggregated by EJ vs. non-EJ populations
Safety
Reduce the number and rate of motorized fatalities and serious injuries
Total number of motor vehicle fatalities (annual)
Total number of serious injuries resulting from motor vehicle crashes
Fatality rate per 100 million VMT (Vehicle Miles Traveled)
Serious injury rate per 100 million VMT
Reduce the number of non-motorized fatalities and serious injuries
Non-motorized fatality and serious injury rate per capita or per 100,000 population
System Management
Improve the condition of all bridges
Percentage of NHS bridges (by deck area) in good condition
Percentage of NHS bridges (by deck area) in poor condition
Improve the lane miles of pavements in good and poor condition
Percentage of Interstate lane miles in good condition
Percentage of Interstate lane miles in poor condition
Improve percent of transit vehicles and facilities in good and poor condition
Percentage of transit revenue vehicles that exceed useful life benchmark (ULB)
Percentage of non-revenue vehicles exceeding ULB
Percentage of facilities rated below 3.0 on FTA's TERM scale (Transit Economic Requirements Model)
Environment
Reduce transportation-related pollutants
Total tons of transportation-related emissions per year (e.g., CO₂, NOₓ, VOCs, PM2.5)
Emissions per capita or per vehicle mile traveled (VMT)
Reduce impact of plan on environmentally sensitive areas
Acres of environmentally sensitive land directly impacted by funded or programmed transportation projects
